results.title: The West's Bold Move to Crack China's Rare Earth Monopoly
results.snippet: Western nations are racing to build independent rare earth and magnet supply chains after China restricted exports of key heavy rare earth elements like dysprosium and terbium. China controls about 90% of global refining and 94% of magnet manufacturing.

results.title: China's Rare Earth Clamp Down Rings Through Avionics Supply Chains and Aircraft Valuations
results.snippet: From the mine to the magnet, the value chain of avionics hardware passes through one of the lesser‑appreciated links: rare earth elements. These elements power the permanent magnets, sensors and high‑performance components inside modern avionics systems.
